responses.content:
```yaml
leads:
  - headline: Regex injection in Radiator View Plugin
    analysis: |
      The  `excludeRegex` parameter of the Radiator View Plugin, which is used to filter jobs displayed in the view, is vulnerable to a regex injection.
      An attacker with Job creation privileges can supply a crafted regular expression to the `excludeRegex` that will cause a denial of service (DoS) on the Jenkins instance.
      This is because the `Pattern.matches` method is used to evaluate the regex, which is known to be vulnerable to ReDoS attacks if a malicious regex is provided.
    cwe: CWE-1333
    function_names:
      - isExcluded
    filenames:
      - src/main/java/hudson/model/RadiatorView.java
    classification: slightly promising
```

leads.headline: Regex injection in Radiator View Plugin
leads.analysis:
The  excludeRegex parameter of the Radiator View Plugin, which is used to filter jobs displayed in the view, is vulnerable to a regex injection.
An attacker with Job creation privileges can supply a crafted regular expression to the excludeRegex that will cause a denial of service (DoS) on the Jenkins instance.
This is because the Pattern.matches method is used to evaluate the regex, which is known to be vulnerable to ReDoS attacks if a malicious regex is provided.
